headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Early Indications of Sickness. Death of Mr. Robert L Stevens. Festival of "Der Alton Houser" in New York. Who go to Blackwell's Island. Fires. POLICE INTELLIGENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: Death of Mr. Robert L Stevens. ROBET L. STEVENS died a this residence, at Hoboken,a t 4 o'clock on Sunday morning. The Sags of the Hoboken boats were worn at half-mast during the day, and a very general expression of sorrow at Hoboken indicated that the residence there recognized his departure as that of one who had been best benefactor of the place.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard steamship Africa, Captain SHANNON, from Liverpool, about 10 A. M. of Saturday, April 5, arrived at this port on Saturday afternoon about 5 o'clock. The following from Lloyd's List may or may not have reference to the Pacific: FIGURIRA, March 24, 1856.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; New Improtation--Interesting Submarine Explorations. Nabbed, and on Exhibition. Yellow Fever.

docs.lead_paragraph: The schooner Searsville, Capt. SEARS, which arrived at this port Saturday, from Trinidad, was loaded principally with old iron guns and an anchor, from the remains of Spanish men-of-war, that were burnt in the Gulf of Paria, near the Port of Spain, In 1797, at the time they were blockaded by the British fleet.

docs.lead_paragraph: Niver-Street, Brooklyn. It is now several years since the owners of a portion of the marsh-land of the Wallabout and in the vicinity of the Naval Hospital, began to calculate the benefits that would acrue from effective drainage.
docs.snippet: Niver-Street, Brooklyn. It is now several years since the owners of a portion of the marsh-land of the Wallabout and in the vicinity of the Naval Hospital, began to calculate the benefits that would acrue from effective drainage.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. mail steamship Canawba, J. D. BULSOCK commander, arrived early yesterday morning, from New-OrleanS vid Havana, having left the latter place on the evening of the 15th. The English manof-war Powerful was still in port, but was to sail in a few days for Bermuda. The U. S. squadron, under Commodore PAULDING, was to sail soon on a cruise to windward, April 13, lat, 260 40', lon, 860 25,.

docs.lead_paragraph: A whale ship is in the outer roadstead, bound to New.Bedford, vid Pernambuco, by which I send this letter, apprising you of the health and tranquility of the city and province, and the whole Empire. I regret to state that the accounts from out Southern neighbours are anything but satisfactory ;

docs.lead_paragraph: The Richmond (Va.) Examiner to out for BUONANAR as the Democratic candidate for President. Hon JOHN P. KENNEDY is on a visit to South Carolina for the benefit of his health, which is somewhat impaired. He intends soon to embark for Europe. The article on "Salvery in Russia," in the last number of the North American Review, is said to have been written by Mrs. ROBINSON, (Talvj,) of this City.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE ALDERMEN. Mayor wood Nominates Harry Howard Tax Receiver-He is Confirmed, in spite of the Statute--Buchanan a K. N. THE COUNCILMEN. Our Benevolent Societies. POLICE INTELLIGENCE. TERRIBLE AFFRAY IN THE SIXTH WARD--ONE MAN FATALLY SH OT. THE PARISH WILL. Contested Wills. COURT CALENDAR--SATURDAY. The Central Park. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS--APRIL TERM,

docs.lead_paragraph: At 5 o' clock, President BARKER called the Aldermen to order, and the roll having been called and the minutes read, the Board was ready for business. After some unimportant matters had been translated, Alderman BROWN called for the consideration of any papers from the Mayor which might be on the table.
